data.name: Rubik's Cube
data.description:
In this Kata we are going to model a Rubik's cube and evaluate the final state
of the cube after a given sequence of moves.

To do this you will implement an execute() function which takes an initial state and 
move sequence as arguments and returns the resulting state:

```javascript
function execute(state, sequence) {
  // your code here
  return state;
}
```

The arguments are defined as follows:

* state: a string containing comma separated face definitions in the order Up, Front, Left, Back, Right and Down
  * Each face definition is given by 9 characters representing the state of each square on the face
  * The 9 characters are organised on each face as per Fig.1 below
  * The faces are oriented for mapping as per Fig.2 below
  * The characters often represent colours (e.g. White, Green, Orange, Blue, Red, Yellow) but could be anything. However they will be consistent, having 6 distinct characters and 9 of each one
  * E.g. "WWWWWWWWW,GGGGGGGGG,OOOOOOOOO,BBBBBBBBB,RRRRRRRRR,YYYYYYYYY"
* sequence: a string in simple Rubik's Cube notation. The faces are identified by their initial letters U, F, L, B, R, D
  * The letters are always upper case.
  * A letter on its own specifies a 90 degree clockwise turn.
  * If the number 2 follows the letter, it is a double turn, or 180 degrees.
  * If a single quote (') follows the letter, it is a 90 degrees anticlockwise turn.
  * There are no delimiters, spaces, or other characters
  * E.g. "RUD'F2"

Fig. 1 - Character Mapping on a Face
```
+---------+
| 0  1  2 |
|         |
| 3  4  5 |
|         |
| 6  7  8 |
+---------+
```


Fig. 2 - Face orientations for mapping the cube state string
```
                  +--------+
                  |        |
                  |   Up   |
                  |        |
+--------+--------+--------+--------+
|        |        |        |        |
|  Back  |  Left  |  Front |  Right |
|        |        |        |        |
+--------+--------+--------+--------+
                  |        |
                  |  Down  |
                  |        |
                  +--------+
```
